result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua James Houle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!

miscConds.notes:
While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806
Def placed on a pymt plan of $50/mo beginning 1 mo.

Upon successful completion of the terms/conditions of this sentence (including payment of all financial obligations) and supervision followed with a letter confirming successful completion from DOC, this record would be expunged!

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Defendant, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
EXCEPT as required for employment.
  The Defendant is subject to random UA testing.
  The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
  Any contraband seized to be forfeited!
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

timeConds.notes:
Def to contact ACJ w/in 10 days to make arrangements.
Def granted credit for time served.
In the alternative, the def may perform 72 hours of community service w/in the next 60 days and shows proof of such to the DA, ACJ, DOC & the Court the jail time would be vacated.
AMENDED 11/24/15 - Def provided proof of community service hrs.  Jail time amended to -0-.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
